reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed as we were going to the moto gp race. Ideal location for laguna seca but this is not a hotel. Room was dark and the noise from other guests was easily heard. More of a motel that needs an upgrade and fast.
reviews.title: Not a hotel!

reviews.text: We paid 300 bucks for a motel (it is not an hotel!!) by far the worst hotel we spent during our honey moon in California and surprisingly at the highest price!!!!
reviews.title: Worst hotel had during our Honey moon in california at the highest price!!!

reviews.text: The value is at least 3 times lower. Ok we were in. A weekend in high season but in any case rate was toom much overpriced and I think should be prohibited over speculate in such way.
reviews.title: Never had a worse hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the room there was a strange smell and there were several spot in the floor. Additionally was very dark, located in front of vending machine and very dirty
reviews.title: we loved it and we will be back

reviews.text: Indoor pool seemed dirty, old and in fact was always empty
reviews.title: Only as a last resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This isn't in line with other Clarion hotels that I have used. I wouldn't even call it a hotel. It is a motel with outside room entrances and very dull dated decor. It does have a pool, which the water was salty, bizarely. The room was clean but not what I expected from this chain. They charged my card twice which is annoying and they have yet to refund me and haven't even acknowledged an email that I sent them 4 days ago so I will now be forced to call them from the UK at considerable cost to myself. I doubt I would use this hotel again but generally I would use Clarion again. I think that this hotel is an oddball compared to others.
reviews.title: More like a Motel

reviews.text: I usually stay on N. Fremont st when in Monterey, as they tend to be cheaper than the ones on Munras ave. However, I decided to splurge a little seeing how the kids were with me on this trip. The indoor pool was what made this hotel stand out from the others. The room was nice, two queen beds that were separated by individual rooms gave the kids their privacy. Room was very clean, and had a lovely balcony. The staff were very friendly. The night clerk was very knowledgeable about the area, and recommended a great place to eat, well as gave me directions to half-moon bay with ease. The morning lady checked us out with a smile, and some times you don't see that at smaller properties. All in all I'm glad I chose this location, was worth paying a little more for.
reviews.title: A good bet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took away one star because of that "smell" in the room - kind of musty. BUT we will make this our regular stop for an overnighter from Napa. Nice BIG fridge to keep our stuff in - microwave, and two clean, and comfortable double beds. Needless to say, for $99.00 - we will be back - however, I'll bring my natural "nectar" air freshener that get's made with essential oils in Berkeley.....
reviews.title: Excellent, basic room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, with our nice, big fan we bring with us from home, we slept very well. And I typically can't sleep.... I did here!
reviews.title: Affordable and clean. Great customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was $69 a night. Diana at the desk was very friendly and helpful with directions, The room was pleasant. It was small but adequate. The hotel is older and prob a 2 star hotel which I am normally leary of but we were on a long extended trip and needed cheap places to stay. So we took a chance and it worked out great. We stayed one night and it was fine. Free parking and free continental breakfast. Small room but seemed clean and was comfortable. It had a fireplace but we didn't use it.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First stayed hear 7 years ago and great to see that it has not changed.
reviews.title: a little gem in Monterey

reviews.text: The motel is well looked after,helpfull staff ,great swimming pool and hot tub.
reviews.title: This is a hotel?

reviews.text: plenty of free parking i can only say how i love this place.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clarion? Hotel? Not really. This place would be more like Choice's Econolodge at best. More like a MOtel or motor inn with outside entrances (I like) and courtyard. But typical of the rest of the joints on this strip, like the Quality Inn next door.
reviews.title: Fine, best deal hotel on the Munras strip I've tried.

reviews.text: I wanted a room with whirlpool tub. Room was very small, partly due to what the tub took up. Tub worked fine and lots of hot water. Bathroom just had shower. Queen bed took up most of the rest of it. It was comfy. HVAC unit worked fine, rattled a bit. 25" tube TV, not many channels, no news or weather. Wireless internet was fine. Room was clean except for some stains & ripping of the carpet. Doing what they can with what they have.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Would stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed here for 2 nights while we went to the Big E they have a deal if you stay there, you can buy tickets/ and shuttle bus to Big E
reviews.title: pleasant stay

reviews.text: Hotel was clean, we were able to check in early, which was a nice surprise.
reviews.title: Be cautious if you have a mold allergy...

reviews.text: first night when we returned to hotel after long day at the Big E, we were able to sit and relax at the Red Parrot Cafe for a drink, apparently they keep that bar open and Hoops extra hours during the Big E, some vendors stay this hotel) it included free breakfast, which was pleasant surprise. This is where we will stay when we go to the Big E again.
reviews.title: STAY AWAY! Especially for wedding room blocks

reviews.text: After reading the reviews I was a little apprehensive. It's a little tricky to find (especially if you're following your GPS) but there is a sign by the main road and the hotel sits in the back. I was surprised at the front of the hotel and my apprehension waned a little at seeing it. (It looks nice from the front!) My friend checked us in (so I don't know what the lobby looks or smells like) but then our instructions were to drive around to the back door (door #5). That is when my apprehensions returned.... The parking lot is very poorly lit and weeds growing in it, and wooded in the back (I wouldn't want to be out there alone at night!). We got to the door we were instructed to go to in and tried swiping our card at the "security box" only to find that our key wasn't working... well, the door wasn't locked and there is no "security" which is why our key wasn't working. The appearance inside was average but the elevator was scary.... It creeks and pops all the way up (where they usually display the license in the elevator there was a sign that said the license was available to view on file in the office - or something to that effect). Somehow our room was on the "business class" level of the hotel. (It left a lot to be desired if this was an upgrade!!) The room appeared clean but is in desperate need of upgrades (which is not a big deal). I'm sure it was a very nice room in the 80's.... The shower has a jacuzzi tub that cannot be used (the "on/off" switch was gone) - not that I'd want to use it! The center of the tub was raised, possibly water has gotten between the floor and the actual tub? I was content with the room until the next morning when I opened the curtains and noticed the wallpaper around the window is peeling and there was mold all the way around the window. I later learned that the window was open a crack and WILL NOT shut - which is probably the cause of the mold. I think if this hotel was properly cared for it could be a nice hotel despite the needed upgrades, but in it's current condition I would not recommend this hotel to anyone (unless they were getting it SUPER CHEAP!!) For the price you can stay across the street at the Hampton Inn (which I've stayed at a couple of years ago and it was nice!!).
reviews.title: so/so

reviews.text: Horrible experience at this hotel for a number of reasons. Terrible service (especially from manager Isabel Gil), attitude, dirty rooms, very dated.
reviews.title: Awesome Waffles!!

reviews.text: front desk was very helpful. we enjoyed the pool, continental breakfast. beds were very comfortable. we were there to visit sprinfield museums with dr sues, statues. convenietly located.
reviews.title: very nice stay

reviews.text: This hotel looks like it was probably a great hotel back in the 80s, but it has steadily gone downhill since then - at least in some areas. The lobby is indeed dated but is relatively nice and shiny and appears adequate. The girl at the desk was very friendly. Through the lobby I got a peek at the atrium and courtyard where the restaurant is, and it looked pretty neat. The first sign of a problem is after you pay and get into your car to drive to the guest parking area. The area was formerly gated, but the gate arms were removed and all of the signs and electronic equipment was left out there to let you know that at least there was formerly security. This is actually one of the first hotels in a while where I actually removed all of my valuables from the rental car. Same with the card entry into the building - after swiping my card a few times I realized that the security thing didn't even work and you could just open the door and walk in. And then you can get in the ancient elevator that has an expired elevator certification posted. In all fairness, the room was fine for my purposes after I turned the air on for a while. It has not been remodeled and the bathroom looks very dated, but it seems clean. For a one night stay I guess I would stay again if the price is right, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone else.
reviews.title: Not the best option around

reviews.text: Was here in June, and I really liked the hotel. Its a very cool hotel. There is a heated indoor pool and jacuzzi right next to a tropical themed bar. The workers were extremely helpful, and Crystal, the front desk lady, went wayyyy out of her way to accommodate my special requests. The free continental breakfast exceeded my expectations. Best I've had actually. Some of the rooms event come with balconies and tables looking out over the pool. This hotel exceeded my expectations and we will definately be staying here again.
reviews.title: Very cool hotel - Would definately stay again

reviews.text: Let's see. I drive back across 4 speed bumps to find a hotel which looks fine in the lobby. But, rooms are dated to say the least and have a room on the "business floor" where the business lounge is closed with paper across the door, the indoor pool is closed, the fitness center, well you will find better, the restaurant and bar at the indoor pool are closed as well.
reviews.title: This hotel may not be around when you check in

reviews.text: Oh let's go the the sports bar at 6PM and no one is in it, including staff. They say they have dinner specials, but if you want anything not fried pass.
reviews.title: Wasn't the greatest.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night and was pleasantly surprised. The room had all the amenities you would expect and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was one of the best pools that we had used in the various other hotels we had stayed in around California.
reviews.title: Worth every penny, will definitely be back

reviews.text: The Receptionist was very helpful and gave us great advise on things to do and things to see on the Big sur.
reviews.title: Swing and a miss . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel provided a very good breakfast and a paper, which I enjoyed.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend a take away pizza from the Del Monte Shopping centre and The fisherman's wharf was good. You can go on Whale watching trips from there and even an interesting Pirate shop for the kids.
reviews.title: We liked it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have noted; dirty, dingy, and sorely in need of new management. Would still be disappointing at half the price. Pool was cold, but only slightly cooler than the shower. Skip this place.
reviews.title: mediocre at best

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location. This hotel needs serious renovations. The rooms were old and worn out. Bathroom was small and no exhaust fan. Showerhead was stuck on massage mode shooting water out at high speed. Room service was bad. The maid left dirty coffee cups and old coffee in the pot. Not very sanitary. Breakfast was a joke. Sausage and eggs every morning. That was the only hot food. I would have eaten better at McDonalds down the street. This hotel is in a great location though with lots of restaurants and shopping across the street. I'll stay elsewhere next time I have to visit the Springfield area
reviews.title: Tired hotel needs renovation

reviews.text: This hotel is well past it's prime. Stained and worn out carpets. Not very clean. Housekeeping missed our room and when I asked the front desk for clean towels the woman at the desk wanted to argue with me. For god sakes it's a towel not a gold bar. I can't think of any reason to stay at this hotel. Skip it and try some others in the area.
reviews.title: Skip this hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel in the past, and I have to say that the overall upkeep is going downhill. There was a strange odor in the hallways, rooms smelled of stale smoke, and the carpeting is getting shabby. The pool area is nice, and there is a small work-out room. The restaurant was better than average, and the bar was OK. Not sure of pricing, as we stayed as part of a convention.
reviews.title: Going downhill
should be razed
reviews.text: Scheduled for two nights in October 2011 but bailed after one. Room and hall carpet filthy, side door broken and open all night, "secure" parking lot gate missing. $100.00/night for this. Dreadful place.
Everything is old. Good concept - pool, game room, bar all in hotel. Flash back to the 80's. Rooms very small.
reviews.title: You can do better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Husband and I have stayed here several times but this time we were not pleased. The interior was shabby, there were problems with the heat, the knob was broken but management came to show my husband how to fix it. The hot water was tepid and the continental breakfast was sadly lacking. The staff however were helpful, the Hoops restaurant has a good burger and nice bar tender. Sadly we probably won't be back. It has alot of potential but needs alot of work done to it.
reviews.title: Deeply Disappointed

reviews.text: Hotel may have had a sprucing up recently. Room was clean, nicely furnished, and seemed well maintained. A slight drip in the bathtub. Internet worked well. Continental Breakfast was fine as continental breakfasts go. Halls a bit worn but generally clean with no garbage or leftover food around. Lobby quite nice with modern furnishings. Staff very pleasant and efficient. Actually seemed a bit better than last year when we stayed here.
reviews.title: Better than some reviews indicate

reviews.text: As a former Western MA resident, I'm particularly familiar with this hotel. As such, over the last 15 or so years, I have visited this hotel a number of times. Unfortunately, this timeline chronicles a downward slope of customer service and overall hotel cleanliness and upkeep.
reviews.title: Gone downhill quickly - a shadow of its former self.

reviews.text: Back when this hotel was a Best Western, it was the premiere spot along Riverdale Road in West Springfield - you had to go to downtown Springfield to get a better quality room, and even that was debatable. Now, with absolutely zero signs of anything having changed from the 90's, it is a remnant of an earlier hayday. It's as if the owners said, "let's not maintain or update a single thing - and let the whole show run on autopilot until we drive it to the ground."
reviews.title: Over priced for what it is
